00056 /* Convert a string boolean to an int; "enable" -> 1 */
00057 int
00058 lnet_parse_bool (int *b, char *str)
00059 {
00060         if (!strcasecmp (str, "no") ||
00061             !strcasecmp (str, "n") ||
00062             !strcasecmp (str, "off") ||
00063             !strcasecmp (str, "down") ||
00064             !strcasecmp (str, "disable"))
00065         {
00066                 *b = 0;
00067                 return (0);
00068         }
00069 
00070         if (!strcasecmp (str, "yes") ||
00071             !strcasecmp (str, "y") ||
00072             !strcasecmp (str, "on") ||
00073             !strcasecmp (str, "up") ||
00074             !strcasecmp (str, "enable"))
00075         {
00076                 *b = 1;
00077                 return (0);
00078         }
00079 
00080         return (-1);
00081 }
00082 
00083 int
00084 lnet_parse_port (int *port, char *str)
00085 {
00086         char      *end;
00087 
00088         *port = strtol (str, &end, 0);
00089 
00090         if (*end == 0 &&                        /* parsed whole string */
00091             *port > 0 && *port < 65536)         /* minimal sanity check */
00092                 return (0);
00093 
00094         return (-1);
00095 }

00097 #ifdef HAVE_GETHOSTBYNAME
00098 static struct hostent *
00099 ptl_gethostbyname(char * hname) {
00100         struct hostent *he;
00101         he = gethostbyname(hname);
00102         if (!he) {
00103                 switch(h_errno) {
00104                 case HOST_NOT_FOUND:
00105                 case NO_ADDRESS:
00106                         fprintf(stderr, "Unable to resolve hostname: %s\n",
00107                                 hname);
00108                         break;
00109                 default:
00110                         fprintf(stderr, "gethostbyname error for %s: %s\n",
00111                                 hname, strerror(h_errno));
00112                         break;
00113                 }
00114                 return NULL;
00115         }
00116         return he;
00117 }
00118 #endif

00120 int
00121 lnet_parse_ipquad (__u32 *ipaddrp, char *str)
00122 {
00123         int             a;
00124         int             b;
00125         int             c;
00126         int             d;
00127 
00128         if (sscanf (str, "%d.%d.%d.%d", &a, &b, &c, &d) == 4 &&
00129             (a & ~0xff) == 0 && (b & ~0xff) == 0 &&
00130             (c & ~0xff) == 0 && (d & ~0xff) == 0)
00131         {
00132                 *ipaddrp = (a<<24)|(b<<16)|(c<<8)|d;
00133                 return (0);
00134         }
00135 
00136         return (-1);
00137 }
00138 
00139 int
00140 lnet_parse_ipaddr (__u32 *ipaddrp, char *str)
00141 {
00142 #ifdef HAVE_GETHOSTBYNAME
00143         struct hostent *he;
00144 #endif
00145 
00146         if (!strcmp (str, "_all_")) {
00147                 *ipaddrp = 0;
00148                 return (0);
00149         }
00150 
00151         if (lnet_parse_ipquad(ipaddrp, str) == 0)
00152                 return (0);
00153 
00154 #ifdef HAVE_GETHOSTBYNAME
00155         if ((('a' <= str[0] && str[0] <= 'z') ||
00156              ('A' <= str[0] && str[0] <= 'Z')) &&
00157              (he = ptl_gethostbyname (str)) != NULL) {
00158                 __u32 addr = *(__u32 *)he->h_addr;
00159 
00160                 *ipaddrp = ntohl(addr);         /* HOST byte order */
00161                 return (0);
00162         }
00163 #endif
00164 
00165         return (-1);
00166 }
00167 
00168 char *
00169 ptl_ipaddr_2_str(__u32 ipaddr, char *str, size_t strsize, int lookup)
00170 {
00171 #ifdef HAVE_GETHOSTBYNAME
00172         __u32           net_ip;
00173         struct hostent *he;
00174 
00175         if (lookup) {
00176                 net_ip = htonl (ipaddr);
00177                 he = gethostbyaddr (&net_ip, sizeof (net_ip), AF_INET);
00178                 if (he != NULL) {
00179                         strlcpy(str, he->h_name, strsize);
00180                         return (str);
00181                 }
00182         }
00183 #endif
00184 
00185         sprintf (str, "%d.%d.%d.%d",
00186                  (ipaddr >> 24) & 0xff, (ipaddr >> 16) & 0xff,
00187                  (ipaddr >> 8) & 0xff, ipaddr & 0xff);
00188         return (str);
00189 }
00190 
00191 int
00192 lnet_parse_time (time_t *t, char *str)
00193 {
00194         char          *end;
00195         int            n;
00196         struct tm      tm;
00197 
00198         *t = strtol (str, &end, 0);
00199         if (*end == 0) /* parsed whole string */
00200                 return (0);
00201 
00202         memset (&tm, 0, sizeof (tm));
00203         n = sscanf (str, "%d-%d-%d-%d:%d:%d",
00204                     &tm.tm_year, &tm.tm_mon, &tm.tm_mday,
00205                     &tm.tm_hour, &tm.tm_min, &tm.tm_sec);
00206         if (n != 6)
00207                 return (-1);
00208 
00209         tm.tm_mon--;                    /* convert to 0 == Jan */
00210         tm.tm_year -= 1900;             /* y2k quirk */
00211         tm.tm_isdst = -1;               /* dunno if it's daylight savings... */
00212 
00213         *t = mktime (&tm);
00214         if (*t == (time_t)-1)
00215                 return (-1);
00216 
00217         return (0);
00218 }

00220 int
00221 lnet_parse_nid(char *nid_str, lnet_process_id_t *id_ptr)
00222 {
00223         id_ptr->pid = LNET_PID_ANY;
00224         id_ptr->nid = libcfs_str2nid(nid_str);
00225         if (id_ptr->nid == LNET_NID_ANY) {
00226                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse nid \"%s\"\n", nid_str);
00227                 return -1;
00228         }
00229 
00230         return 0;
00231 }
00232 
00233 static int g_net_is_set(char *cmd)
00234 {
00235         if (g_net_set)
00236                 return 1;
00237 
00238         if (cmd != NULL) {
00239                 char *net;
00240 
00241                 if (g_net_interactive)
00242                         net = "network";
00243                 else
00244                         net = "--net";
00245 
00246                 fprintf(stderr,
00247                         "You must run '%s <network>' command before '%s'\n",
00248                         cmd, net);
00249                 return 0;
00250         }
00251 
00252         return 0;
00253 }
00254 
00255 static int g_net_is_compatible(char *cmd, ...)
00256 {
00257         va_list ap;
00258         int nal;
00259 
00260         if (!g_net_is_set(cmd))
00261                 return 0;
00262 
00263         va_start(ap, cmd);
00264 
00265         do {
00266                 nal = va_arg(ap, int);
00267                 if (nal == LNET_NETTYP(g_net)) {
00268                         va_end (ap);
00269                         return 1;
00270                 }
00271         } while (nal != 0);
00272 
00273         va_end (ap);
00274 
00275         if (cmd != NULL)
00276                 fprintf (stderr,
00277                          "Command %s not compatible with %s NAL\n",
00278                          cmd,
00279                          libcfs_lnd2str(LNET_NETTYP(g_net)));
00280 
00281         return 0;
00282 }

00284 int ptl_initialize(int argc, char **argv)
00285 {
00286         if (argc > 1)
00287                 g_net_interactive = true;
00288 
00289         register_ioc_dev(LNET_DEV_ID, LNET_DEV_PATH,
00290                          LNET_DEV_MAJOR, LNET_DEV_MINOR);
00291         return 0;
00292 }

00294 
00295 int jt_ptl_network(int argc, char **argv)
00296 {
00297         struct libcfs_ioctl_data data;
00298         __u32 net = LNET_NIDNET(LNET_NID_ANY);
00299         int rc;
00300 
00301         if (argc != 2) {
00302                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s <net>|up|down\n", argv[0]);
00303                 return -1;
00304         }
00305 
00306         if (!strcmp(argv[1], "unconfigure") || !strcmp(argv[1], "down")) {
00307                 LIBCFS_IOC_INIT(data);
00308                 rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_UNCONFIGURE, &data);
00309 
00310                 if (rc == 0) {
00311                         printf("LNET ready to unload\n");
00312                         return 0;
00313                 }
00314 
00315                 if (errno == EBUSY)
00316                         fprintf(stderr, "LNET busy\n");
00317                 else
00318                         fprintf(stderr, "LNET unconfigure error %d: %s\n",
00319                                 errno, strerror(errno));
00320                 return -1;
00321         } else if (!strcmp(argv[1], "configure") || !strcmp(argv[1], "up")) {
00322                 LIBCFS_IOC_INIT(data);
00323                 rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_CONFIGURE, &data);
00324 
00325                 if (rc == 0) {
00326                         printf("LNET configured\n");
00327                         return 0;
00328                 }
00329 
00330                 fprintf(stderr, "LNET configure error %d: %s\n",
00331                         errno, strerror(errno));
00332                 return -1;
00333         }
00334 
00335         net = libcfs_str2net(argv[1]);
00336         if (net == LNET_NIDNET(LNET_NID_ANY)) {
00337                 fprintf(stderr, "Can't parse net %s\n", argv[1]);
00338                 return -1;
00339         }
00340 
00341         if (LNET_NETTYP(net) == QSWLND || LNET_NETTYP(net) == GMLND ||
00342             LNET_NETTYP(net) == PTLLND || LNET_NETTYP(net) == CIBLND ||
00343             LNET_NETTYP(net) == OPENIBLND || LNET_NETTYP(net) == IIBLND ||
00344             LNET_NETTYP(net) == RALND || LNET_NETTYP(net) == VIBLND ||
00345             LNET_NETTYP(net) == MXLND) {
00346                 fprintf(stderr, "Net %s obsoleted\n", libcfs_lnd2str(net));
00347                 return -1;
00348         }
00349 
00350         g_net_set = true;
00351         g_net = net;
00352         return 0;
00353 }
00354 
00355 int
00356 jt_ptl_list_nids(int argc, char **argv)
00357 {
00358         struct libcfs_ioctl_data data;
00359         int                      all = 0, return_nid = 0;
00360         int                      count;
00361         int                      rc;
00362 
00363         all = (argc == 2) && (strcmp(argv[1], "all") == 0);
00364         /* Hack to pass back value */
00365         return_nid = (argc == 2) && (argv[1][0] == 1);
00366 
00367         if ((argc > 2) && !(all || return_nid)) {
00368                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s [all]\n", argv[0]);
00369                 return 0;
00370         }
00371 
00372         for (count = 0;; count++) {
00373                 LIBCFS_IOC_INIT (data);
00374                 data.ioc_count = count;
00375                 rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_GET_NI, &data);
00376 
00377                 if (rc < 0) {
00378                         if ((count > 0) && (errno == ENOENT))
00379                                 /* We found them all */
00380                                 break;
00381                         fprintf(stderr,"IOC_LIBCFS_GET_NI error %d: %s\n",
00382                                 errno, strerror(errno));
00383                         return -1;
00384                 }
00385 
00386                 if (all || (LNET_NETTYP(LNET_NIDNET(data.ioc_nid)) != LOLND)) {
00387                         printf("%s\n", libcfs_nid2str(data.ioc_nid));
00388                         if (return_nid) {
00389                                 *(__u64 *)(argv[1]) = data.ioc_nid;
00390                                 return_nid--;
00391                         }
00392                 }
00393         }
00394 
00395         return 0;
00396 }
00397 
00398 int
00399 jt_ptl_which_nid (int argc, char **argv)
00400 {
00401         struct libcfs_ioctl_data data;
00402         int          best_dist = 0;
00403         int          best_order = 0;
00404         lnet_nid_t   best_nid = LNET_NID_ANY;
00405         int          dist;
00406         int          order;
00407         lnet_nid_t   nid;
00408         char        *nidstr;
00409         int          rc;
00410         int          i;
00411 
00412         if (argc < 2) {
00413                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s NID [NID...]\n", argv[0]);
00414                 return 0;
00415         }
00416 
00417         for (i = 1; i < argc; i++) {
00418                 nidstr = argv[i];
00419                 nid = libcfs_str2nid(nidstr);
00420                 if (nid == LNET_NID_ANY) {
00421                         fprintf(stderr, "Can't parse NID %s\n", nidstr);
00422                         return -1;
00423                 }
00424 
00425                 LIBCFS_IOC_INIT(data);
00426                 data.ioc_nid = nid;
00427 
00428                 rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_LNET_DIST, &data);
00429                 if (rc != 0) {
00430                         fprintf(stderr, "Can't get distance to %s: %s\n",
00431                                 nidstr, strerror(errno));
00432                         return -1;
00433                 }
00434 
00435                 dist = data.ioc_u32[0];
00436                 order = data.ioc_u32[1];
00437 
00438                 if (dist < 0) {
00439                         if (dist == -EHOSTUNREACH)
00440                                 continue;
00441 
00442                         fprintf(stderr, "Unexpected distance to %s: %d\n",
00443                                 nidstr, dist);
00444                         return -1;
00445                 }
00446 
00447                 if (best_nid == LNET_NID_ANY ||
00448                     dist < best_dist ||
00449                     (dist == best_dist && order < best_order)) {
00450                         best_dist = dist;
00451                         best_order = order;
00452                         best_nid = nid;
00453                 }
00454         }
00455 
00456         if (best_nid == LNET_NID_ANY) {
00457                 fprintf(stderr, "No reachable NID\n");
00458                 return -1;
00459         }
00460 
00461         printf("%s\n", libcfs_nid2str(best_nid));
00462         return 0;
00463 }
00464 
00465 int
00466 jt_ptl_print_interfaces (int argc, char **argv)
00467 {
00468         struct libcfs_ioctl_data data;
00469         char                     buffer[3][HOST_NAME_MAX + 1];
00470         int                      index;
00471         int                      rc;
00472 
00473         if (!g_net_is_compatible (argv[0], SOCKLND, 0))
00474                 return -1;
00475 
00476         for (index = 0;;index++) {
00477                 LIBCFS_IOC_INIT(data);
00478                 data.ioc_net   = g_net;
00479                 data.ioc_count = index;
00480 
00481                 rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_GET_INTERFACE, &data);
00482                 if (rc != 0)
00483                         break;
00484 
00485                 printf ("%s: (%s/%s) npeer %d nroute %d\n",
00486                         ptl_ipaddr_2_str(data.ioc_u32[0], buffer[2],
00487                                          sizeof(buffer[2]), 1),
00488                         ptl_ipaddr_2_str(data.ioc_u32[0], buffer[0],
00489                                          sizeof(buffer[0]), 0),
00490                         ptl_ipaddr_2_str(data.ioc_u32[1], buffer[1],
00491                                          sizeof(buffer[1]), 0),
00492                         data.ioc_u32[2], data.ioc_u32[3]);
00493         }
00494 
00495         if (index == 0) {
00496                 if (errno == ENOENT) {
00497                         printf ("<no interfaces>\n");
00498                 } else {
00499                         fprintf(stderr, "Error getting interfaces: %s: "
00500                                 "check dmesg.\n",
00501                                 strerror(errno));
00502                 }
00503         }
00504 
00505         return 0;
00506 }
00507 
00508 int
00509 jt_ptl_add_interface (int argc, char **argv)
00510 {
00511         struct libcfs_ioctl_data data;
00512         __u32                    ipaddr;
00513         int                      rc;
00514         __u32                    netmask = 0xffffff00;
00515         int                      i;
00516         int                      count;
00517         char                    *end;
00518 
00519         if (argc < 2 || argc > 3) {
00520                 fprintf (stderr, "usage: %s ipaddr [netmask]\n", argv[0]);
00521                 return 0;
00522         }
00523 
00524         if (!g_net_is_compatible(argv[0], SOCKLND, 0))
00525                 return -1;
00526 
00527         if (lnet_parse_ipaddr(&ipaddr, argv[1]) != 0) {
00528                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse ip: %s\n", argv[1]);
00529                 return -1;
00530         }
00531 
00532         if (argc > 2 ) {
00533                 count = strtol(argv[2], &end, 0);
00534                 if (count > 0 && count < 32 && *end == 0) {
00535                         netmask = 0;
00536                         for (i = count; i > 0; i--)
00537                                 netmask = netmask|(1<<(32-i));
00538                 } else if (lnet_parse_ipquad(&netmask, argv[2]) != 0) {
00539                         fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse netmask: %s\n", argv[2]);
00540                         return -1;
00541                 }
00542         }
00543 
00544         LIBCFS_IOC_INIT(data);
00545         data.ioc_net    = g_net;
00546         data.ioc_u32[0] = ipaddr;
00547         data.ioc_u32[1] = netmask;
00548 
00549         rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_ADD_INTERFACE, &data);
00550         if (rc != 0) {
00551                 fprintf (stderr, "failed to add interface: %s\n",
00552                          strerror (errno));
00553                 return -1;
00554         }
00555 
00556         return 0;
00557 }
00558 
00559 int
00560 jt_ptl_del_interface (int argc, char **argv)
00561 {
00562         struct libcfs_ioctl_data data;
00563         int                      rc;
00564         __u32                    ipaddr = 0;
00565 
00566         if (argc > 2) {
00567                 fprintf (stderr, "usage: %s [ipaddr]\n", argv[0]);
00568                 return 0;
00569         }
00570 
00571         if (!g_net_is_compatible(argv[0], SOCKLND, 0))
00572                 return -1;
00573 
00574         if (argc == 2 &&
00575             lnet_parse_ipaddr(&ipaddr, argv[1]) != 0) {
00576                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse ip: %s\n", argv[1]);
00577                 return -1;
00578         }
00579 
00580         LIBCFS_IOC_INIT(data);
00581         data.ioc_net    = g_net;
00582         data.ioc_u32[0] = ipaddr;
00583 
00584         rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_DEL_INTERFACE, &data);
00585         if (rc != 0) {
00586                 fprintf (stderr, "failed to delete interface: %s\n",
00587                          strerror (errno));
00588                 return -1;
00589         }
00590 
00591         return 0;
00592 }
00593 
00594 int
00595 jt_ptl_print_peers (int argc, char **argv)
00596 {
00597         struct libcfs_ioctl_data data;
00598         lnet_process_id_t        id;
00599         char                     buffer[2][HOST_NAME_MAX + 1];
00600         int                      index;
00601         int                      rc;
00602 
00603         if (!g_net_is_compatible (argv[0], SOCKLND, O2IBLND, GNILND, 0))
00604                 return -1;
00605 
00606         for (index = 0;;index++) {
00607                 LIBCFS_IOC_INIT(data);
00608                 data.ioc_net     = g_net;
00609                 data.ioc_count   = index;
00610 
00611                 rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_GET_PEER, &data);
00612                 if (rc != 0)
00613                         break;
00614 
00615                 if (g_net_is_compatible(NULL, SOCKLND, 0)) {
00616                         id.nid = data.ioc_nid;
00617                         id.pid = data.ioc_u32[4];
00618                         printf ("%-20s [%d]%s->%s:%d #%d\n",
00619                                 libcfs_id2str(id),
00620                                 data.ioc_count, /* persistence */
00621                                 /* my ip */
00622                                 ptl_ipaddr_2_str(data.ioc_u32[2], buffer[0],
00623                                                  sizeof(buffer[0]), 1),
00624                                 /* peer ip */
00625                                 ptl_ipaddr_2_str(data.ioc_u32[0], buffer[1],
00626                                                  sizeof(buffer[1]), 1),
00627                                 data.ioc_u32[1], /* peer port */
00628                                 data.ioc_u32[3]); /* conn_count */
00629                 } else if (g_net_is_compatible(NULL, GNILND, 0)) {
00630                         int disconn = data.ioc_flags >> 16;
00631                         char *state;
00632 
00633                         if (disconn)
00634                                 state = "D";
00635                         else
00636                                 state = data.ioc_flags & 0xffff ? "C" : "U";
00637 
00638                         printf("%-20s (%d) %s [%d] %ju sq %d/%d tx %d/%d/%d\n",
00639                                libcfs_nid2str(data.ioc_nid), /* peer nid */
00640                                data.ioc_net, /* gemini device id */
00641                                state, /* peer is Connecting, Up, or Down */
00642                                data.ioc_count,   /* peer refcount */
00643                                (uintmax_t)data.ioc_u64[0], /* peerstamp */
00644                                data.ioc_u32[2], data.ioc_u32[3], /* tx and rx seq */
00645                                /* fmaq, nfma, nrdma */
00646                                data.ioc_u32[0], data.ioc_u32[1], data.ioc_u32[4]);
00647                 } else {
00648                         printf ("%-20s [%d]\n",
00649                                 libcfs_nid2str(data.ioc_nid), data.ioc_count);
00650                 }
00651         }
00652 
00653         if (index == 0) {
00654                 if (errno == ENOENT) {
00655                         printf ("<no peers>\n");
00656                 } else {
00657                         fprintf(stderr, "Error getting peer list: %s: "
00658                                 "check dmesg.\n",
00659                                 strerror(errno));
00660                 }
00661         }
00662         return 0;
00663 }
00664 
00665 int jt_ptl_add_peer(int argc, char **argv)
00666 {
00667         struct libcfs_ioctl_data data;
00668         lnet_nid_t nid;
00669         __u32 ip = 0;
00670         int port = 0;
00671         int rc;
00672 
00673         if (!g_net_is_compatible(argv[0], SOCKLND, GNILND, 0))
00674                 return -1;
00675 
00676         if (argc != 4) {
00677                 fprintf(stderr, "usage(tcp,gni): %s nid ipaddr port\n",
00678                         argv[0]);
00679                 return 0;
00680         }
00681 
00682         nid = libcfs_str2nid(argv[1]);
00683         if (nid == LNET_NID_ANY) {
00684                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse NID: %s\n", argv[1]);
00685                 return -1;
00686         }
00687 
00688         if (lnet_parse_ipaddr (&ip, argv[2]) != 0) {
00689                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse ip addr: %s\n", argv[2]);
00690                 return -1;
00691         }
00692 
00693         if (lnet_parse_port (&port, argv[3]) != 0) {
00694                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse port: %s\n", argv[3]);
00695                 return -1;
00696         }
00697 
00698         LIBCFS_IOC_INIT(data);
00699         data.ioc_net    = g_net;
00700         data.ioc_nid    = nid;
00701         data.ioc_u32[0] = ip;
00702         data.ioc_u32[1] = port;
00703 
00704         rc = l_ioctl (LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_ADD_PEER, &data);
00705         if (rc != 0) {
00706                 fprintf (stderr, "failed to add peer: %s\n",
00707                          strerror (errno));
00708                 return -1;
00709         }
00710 
00711         return 0;
00712 }
00713 
00714 int
00715 jt_ptl_del_peer (int argc, char **argv)
00716 {
00717         struct libcfs_ioctl_data data;
00718         lnet_nid_t               nid = LNET_NID_ANY;
00719         lnet_pid_t               pid = LNET_PID_ANY;
00720         __u32                    ip = 0;
00721         int                      rc;
00722 
00723         if (!g_net_is_compatible(argv[0], SOCKLND, O2IBLND, GNILND, 0))
00724                 return -1;
00725 
00726         if (g_net_is_compatible(NULL, SOCKLND, 0)) {
00727                 if (argc > 3) {
00728                         fprintf (stderr, "usage: %s [nid] [ipaddr]\n",
00729                                  argv[0]);
00730                         return 0;
00731                 }
00732         } else if (argc > 2) {
00733                 fprintf (stderr, "usage: %s [nid]\n", argv[0]);
00734                 return 0;
00735         }
00736 
00737         if (argc > 1 &&
00738             !libcfs_str2anynid(&nid, argv[1])) {
00739                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse nid: %s\n", argv[1]);
00740                 return -1;
00741         }
00742 
00743         if (g_net_is_compatible(NULL, SOCKLND, 0)) {
00744                 if (argc > 2 &&
00745                     lnet_parse_ipaddr (&ip, argv[2]) != 0) {
00746                         fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse ip addr: %s\n",
00747                                  argv[2]);
00748                         return -1;
00749                 }
00750         }
00751 
00752         LIBCFS_IOC_INIT(data);
00753         data.ioc_net    = g_net;
00754         data.ioc_nid    = nid;
00755         data.ioc_u32[0] = ip;
00756         data.ioc_u32[1] = pid;
00757 
00758         rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_DEL_PEER, &data);
00759         if (rc != 0) {
00760                 fprintf (stderr, "failed to remove peer: %s\n",
00761                          strerror (errno));
00762                 return -1;
00763         }
00764 
00765         return 0;
00766 }
00767 
00768 int
00769 jt_ptl_print_connections (int argc, char **argv)
00770 {
00771         struct libcfs_ioctl_data data;
00772         lnet_process_id_t        id;
00773         char                     buffer[2][HOST_NAME_MAX + 1];
00774         int                      index;
00775         int                      rc;
00776 
00777         if (!g_net_is_compatible(argv[0], SOCKLND, O2IBLND, GNILND, 0))
00778                 return -1;
00779 
00780         for (index = 0; ; index++) {
00781                 LIBCFS_IOC_INIT(data);
00782                 data.ioc_net     = g_net;
00783                 data.ioc_count   = index;
00784 
00785                 rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_GET_CONN, &data);
00786                 if (rc != 0)
00787                         break;
00788 
00789                 if (g_net_is_compatible (NULL, SOCKLND, 0)) {
00790                         id.nid = data.ioc_nid;
00791                         id.pid = data.ioc_u32[6];
00792                         printf ("%-20s %s[%d]%s->%s:%d %d/%d %s\n",
00793                                 libcfs_id2str(id),
00794                                 (data.ioc_u32[3] == SOCKLND_CONN_ANY) ? "A" :
00795                                 (data.ioc_u32[3] == SOCKLND_CONN_CONTROL) ? "C" :
00796                                 (data.ioc_u32[3] == SOCKLND_CONN_BULK_IN) ? "I" :
00797                                 (data.ioc_u32[3] == SOCKLND_CONN_BULK_OUT) ? "O" : "?",
00798                                 data.ioc_u32[4], /* scheduler */
00799                                 /* local IP addr */
00800                                 ptl_ipaddr_2_str(data.ioc_u32[2], buffer[0],
00801                                                  sizeof(buffer[0]), 1),
00802                                 /* remote IP addr */
00803                                 ptl_ipaddr_2_str(data.ioc_u32[0], buffer[1],
00804                                                  sizeof(buffer[1]), 1),
00805                                 data.ioc_u32[1],         /* remote port */
00806                                 data.ioc_count, /* tx buffer size */
00807                                 data.ioc_u32[5], /* rx buffer size */
00808                                 data.ioc_flags ? "nagle" : "nonagle");
00809                 } else if (g_net_is_compatible (NULL, O2IBLND, 0)) {
00810                         printf ("%s mtu %d\n",
00811                                 libcfs_nid2str(data.ioc_nid),
00812                                 data.ioc_u32[0]); /* path MTU */
00813                 } else if (g_net_is_compatible (NULL, GNILND, 0)) {
00814                         printf ("%-20s [%d]\n",
00815                                 libcfs_nid2str(data.ioc_nid),
00816                                 data.ioc_u32[0] /* device id */);
00817                 } else {
00818                         printf ("%s\n", libcfs_nid2str(data.ioc_nid));
00819                 }
00820         }
00821 
00822         if (index == 0) {
00823                 if (errno == ENOENT) {
00824                         printf ("<no connections>\n");
00825                 } else {
00826                         fprintf(stderr, "Error getting connection list: %s: "
00827                                 "check dmesg.\n",
00828                                 strerror(errno));
00829                 }
00830         }
00831         return 0;
00832 }
00833 
00834 int jt_ptl_disconnect(int argc, char **argv)
00835 {
00836         struct libcfs_ioctl_data data;
00837         lnet_nid_t               nid = LNET_NID_ANY;
00838         __u32                    ipaddr = 0;
00839         int                      rc;
00840 
00841         if (argc > 3) {
00842                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s [nid] [ipaddr]\n", argv[0]);
00843                 return 0;
00844         }
00845 
00846         if (!g_net_is_compatible(NULL, SOCKLND, O2IBLND, GNILND, 0))
00847                 return 0;
00848 
00849         if (argc >= 2 &&
00850             !libcfs_str2anynid(&nid, argv[1])) {
00851                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse nid %s\n", argv[1]);
00852                 return -1;
00853         }
00854 
00855         if (g_net_is_compatible (NULL, SOCKLND, 0) &&
00856             argc >= 3 &&
00857             lnet_parse_ipaddr (&ipaddr, argv[2]) != 0) {
00858                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse ip addr %s\n", argv[2]);
00859                 return -1;
00860         }
00861 
00862         LIBCFS_IOC_INIT(data);
00863         data.ioc_net     = g_net;
00864         data.ioc_nid     = nid;
00865         data.ioc_u32[0]  = ipaddr;
00866 
00867         rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_CLOSE_CONNECTION, &data);
00868         if (rc != 0) {
00869                 fprintf(stderr, "failed to remove connection: %s\n",
00870                         strerror(errno));
00871                 return -1;
00872         }
00873 
00874         return 0;
00875 }
00876 
00877 int jt_ptl_push_connection (int argc, char **argv)
00878 {
00879         struct libcfs_ioctl_data data;
00880         int                      rc;
00881         lnet_nid_t               nid = LNET_NID_ANY;
00882 
00883         if (argc > 2) {
00884                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s [nid]\n", argv[0]);
00885                 return 0;
00886         }
00887 
00888         if (!g_net_is_compatible (argv[0], SOCKLND, GNILND, 0))
00889                 return -1;
00890 
00891         if (argc > 1 &&
00892             !libcfs_str2anynid(&nid, argv[1])) {
00893                 fprintf(stderr, "Can't parse nid: %s\n", argv[1]);
00894                 return -1;
00895         }
00896 
00897         LIBCFS_IOC_INIT(data);
00898         data.ioc_net     = g_net;
00899         data.ioc_nid     = nid;
00900 
00901         rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_PUSH_CONNECTION, &data);
00902         if (rc != 0) {
00903                 fprintf(stderr, "failed to push connection: %s\n",
00904                         strerror(errno));
00905                 return -1;
00906         }
00907 
00908         return 0;
00909 }
00910 
00911 int jt_ptl_ping(int argc, char **argv)
00912 {
00913         int                      rc;
00914         int                      timeout;
00915         lnet_process_id_t        id;
00916         lnet_process_id_t        ids[16];
00917         int                      maxids = sizeof(ids)/sizeof(ids[0]);
00918         struct libcfs_ioctl_data data;
00919         char                    *sep;
00920         int                      i;
00921 
00922         if (argc < 2) {
00923                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s id [timeout (secs)]\n", argv[0]);
00924                 return 0;
00925         }
00926 
00927         sep = strchr(argv[1], '-');
00928         if (sep == NULL) {
00929                 rc = lnet_parse_nid(argv[1], &id);
00930                 if (rc != 0)
00931                         return -1;
00932         } else {
00933                 char   *end;
00934 
00935                 if (argv[1][0] == 'u' ||
00936                     argv[1][0] == 'U')
00937                         id.pid = strtoul(&argv[1][1], &end, 0) | LNET_PID_USERFLAG;
00938                 else
00939                         id.pid = strtoul(argv[1], &end, 0);
00940 
00941                 if (end != sep) { /* assuming '-' is part of hostname */
00942                         rc = lnet_parse_nid(argv[1], &id);
00943                         if (rc != 0)
00944                                 return -1;
00945                 } else {
00946                         id.nid = libcfs_str2nid(sep + 1);
00947 
00948                         if (id.nid == LNET_NID_ANY) {
00949                                 fprintf(stderr,
00950                                         "Can't parse process id \"%s\"\n",
00951                                         argv[1]);
00952                                 return -1;
00953                         }
00954                 }
00955         }
00956 
00957         if (argc > 2)
00958                 timeout = 1000 * atol(argv[2]);
00959         else
00960                 timeout = 1000;                 /* default 1 second timeout */
00961 
00962         LIBCFS_IOC_INIT (data);
00963         data.ioc_nid     = id.nid;
00964         data.ioc_u32[0]  = id.pid;
00965         data.ioc_u32[1]  = timeout;
00966         data.ioc_plen1   = sizeof(ids);
00967         data.ioc_pbuf1   = (char *)ids;
00968 
00969         rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_PING, &data);
00970         if (rc != 0) {
00971                 fprintf(stderr, "failed to ping %s: %s\n",
00972                         id.pid == LNET_PID_ANY ?
00973                         libcfs_nid2str(id.nid) : libcfs_id2str(id),
00974                         strerror(errno));
00975                 return -1;
00976         }
00977 
00978         for (i = 0; i < data.ioc_count && i < maxids; i++)
00979                 printf("%s\n", libcfs_id2str(ids[i]));
00980 
00981         if (data.ioc_count > maxids)
00982                 printf("%d out of %d ids listed\n", maxids, data.ioc_count);
00983 
00984         return 0;
00985 }
00986 
00987 int jt_ptl_mynid(int argc, char **argv)
00988 {
00989         struct libcfs_ioctl_data data;
00990         lnet_nid_t               nid;
00991         int rc;
00992 
00993         if (argc != 2) {
00994                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s NID\n", argv[0]);
00995                 return 0;
00996         }
00997 
00998         nid = libcfs_str2nid(argv[1]);
00999         if (nid == LNET_NID_ANY) {
01000                 fprintf(stderr, "Can't parse NID '%s'\n", argv[1]);
01001                 return -1;
01002         }
01003 
01004         LIBCFS_IOC_INIT(data);
01005         data.ioc_net = LNET_NIDNET(nid);
01006         data.ioc_nid = nid;
01007 
01008         rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_REGISTER_MYNID, &data);
01009         if (rc < 0)
01010                 fprintf(stderr, "setting my NID failed: %s\n",
01011                        strerror(errno));
01012         else
01013                 printf("registered my nid %s\n", libcfs_nid2str(nid));
01014 
01015         return 0;
01016 }
01017 
01018 int
01019 jt_ptl_fail_nid (int argc, char **argv)
01020 {
01021         int                      rc;
01022         lnet_nid_t               nid;
01023         int                      threshold;
01024         struct libcfs_ioctl_data data;
01025 
01026         if (argc < 2 || argc > 3)
01027         {
01028                 fprintf (stderr, "usage: %s nid|\"*\" [count (0 == mend)]\n", argv[0]);
01029                 return (0);
01030         }
01031 
01032         if (!libcfs_str2anynid(&nid, argv[1]))
01033         {
01034                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse nid \"%s\"\n", argv[1]);
01035                 return (-1);
01036         }
01037 
01038         if (argc < 3) {
01039                 threshold = LNET_MD_THRESH_INF;
01040         } else if (sscanf(argv[2], "%i", &threshold) != 1) {
01041                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse count \"%s\"\n", argv[2]);
01042                 return (-1);
01043         }
01044 
01045         LIBCFS_IOC_INIT (data);
01046         data.ioc_nid = nid;
01047         data.ioc_count = threshold;
01048 
01049         rc = l_ioctl (LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_FAIL_NID, &data);
01050         if (rc < 0)
01051                 fprintf (stderr, "IOC_LIBCFS_FAIL_NID failed: %s\n",
01052                          strerror (errno));
01053         else
01054                 printf ("%s %s\n", threshold == 0 ? "Unfailing" : "Failing", argv[1]);
01055 
01056         return (0);
01057 }
01058 
01059 int
01060 jt_ptl_add_route (int argc, char **argv)
01061 {
01062         struct lnet_ioctl_config_data data;
01063         lnet_nid_t               gateway_nid;
01064         __u32                    hops = LNET_UNDEFINED_HOPS;
01065         unsigned int             priority = 0;
01066         char                    *end;
01067         int                      rc;
01068 
01069         if (argc < 2 || argc > 4) {
01070                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s gateway [hopcount [priority]]\n",
01071                         argv[0]);
01072                 return -1;
01073         }
01074 
01075         if (g_net_is_set(argv[0]) == 0)
01076                 return -1;
01077 
01078         gateway_nid = libcfs_str2nid(argv[1]);
01079         if (gateway_nid == LNET_NID_ANY) {
01080                 fprintf(stderr, "Can't parse gateway NID \"%s\"\n", argv[1]);
01081                 return -1;
01082         }
01083 
01084         if (argc > 2) {
01085                 hops = strtol(argv[2], &end, 0);
01086                 if (hops == 0 || hops >= 256 ||
01087                     (end != NULL && *end != 0)) {
01088                         fprintf(stderr, "Can't parse hopcount \"%s\"\n",
01089                                 argv[2]);
01090                         return -1;
01091                 }
01092                 if (argc == 4) {
01093                         priority = strtoul(argv[3], &end, 0);
01094                         if (end != NULL && *end != 0) {
01095                                 fprintf(stderr,
01096                                         "Can't parse priority \"%s\"\n",
01097                                         argv[3]);
01098                                 return -1;
01099                         }
01100                 }
01101         }
01102 
01103         LIBCFS_IOC_INIT_V2(data, cfg_hdr);
01104         data.cfg_net = g_net;
01105         data.cfg_config_u.cfg_route.rtr_hop = hops;
01106         data.cfg_nid = gateway_nid;
01107         data.cfg_config_u.cfg_route.rtr_priority = priority;
01108 
01109         rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_ADD_ROUTE, &data);
01110         if (rc != 0) {
01111                 fprintf(stderr, "IOC_LIBCFS_ADD_ROUTE failed: %s\n",
01112                         strerror(errno));
01113                 return -1;
01114         }
01115 
01116         return 0;
01117 }
01118 
01119 int
01120 jt_ptl_del_route (int argc, char **argv)
01121 {
01122         struct lnet_ioctl_config_data data;
01123         lnet_nid_t               nid;
01124         int                      rc;
01125 
01126         if (argc != 2) {
01127                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s gatewayNID\n", argv[0]);
01128                 return 0;
01129         }
01130 
01131         if (libcfs_str2anynid(&nid, argv[1]) == 0) {
01132                 fprintf(stderr, "Can't parse gateway NID "
01133                         "\"%s\"\n", argv[1]);
01134                 return -1;
01135         }
01136 
01137         LIBCFS_IOC_INIT_V2(data, cfg_hdr);
01138         data.cfg_net = g_net_set ? g_net : LNET_NIDNET(LNET_NID_ANY);
01139         data.cfg_nid = nid;
01140 
01141         rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_DEL_ROUTE, &data);
01142         if (rc != 0) {
01143                 fprintf(stderr, "IOC_LIBCFS_DEL_ROUTE (%s) failed: %s\n",
01144                         libcfs_nid2str(nid), strerror(errno));
01145                 return -1;
01146         }
01147 
01148         return 0;
01149 }
01150 
01151 int
01152 jt_ptl_notify_router (int argc, char **argv)
01153 {
01154         struct libcfs_ioctl_data data;
01155         int                      enable;
01156         lnet_nid_t               nid;
01157         int                      rc;
01158         struct timeval           now;
01159         time_t                   when;
01160 
01161         if (argc < 3)
01162         {
01163                 fprintf (stderr, "usage: %s targetNID <up/down> [<time>]\n", 
01164                          argv[0]);
01165                 return (0);
01166         }
01167 
01168         nid = libcfs_str2nid(argv[1]);
01169         if (nid == LNET_NID_ANY) {
01170                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse target NID \"%s\"\n", argv[1]);
01171                 return (-1);
01172         }
01173 
01174         if (lnet_parse_bool (&enable, argv[2]) != 0) {
01175                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse boolean %s\n", argv[2]);
01176                 return (-1);
01177         }
01178 
01179         gettimeofday(&now, NULL);
01180 
01181         if (argc < 4) {
01182                 when = now.tv_sec;
01183         } else if (lnet_parse_time (&when, argv[3]) != 0) {
01184                 fprintf(stderr, "Can't parse time %s\n"
01185                         "Please specify either 'YYYY-MM-DD-HH:MM:SS'\n"
01186                         "or an absolute unix time in seconds\n", argv[3]);
01187                 return (-1);
01188         } else if (when > now.tv_sec) {
01189                 fprintf (stderr, "%s specifies a time in the future\n",
01190                          argv[3]);
01191                 return (-1);
01192         }
01193 
01194         LIBCFS_IOC_INIT(data);
01195         data.ioc_nid = nid;
01196         data.ioc_flags = enable;
01197         /* Yeuch; 'cept I need a __u64 on 64 bit machines... */
01198         data.ioc_u64[0] = (__u64)when;
01199 
01200         rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_NOTIFY_ROUTER, &data);
01201         if (rc != 0) {
01202                 fprintf (stderr, "IOC_LIBCFS_NOTIFY_ROUTER (%s) failed: %s\n",
01203                          libcfs_nid2str(nid), strerror (errno));
01204                 return (-1);
01205         }
01206 
01207         return (0);
01208 }
01209 
01210 int
01211 jt_ptl_print_routes (int argc, char **argv)
01212 {
01213         struct lnet_ioctl_config_data  data;
01214         int                       rc;
01215         int                       index;
01216         __u32                     net;
01217         lnet_nid_t                nid;
01218         unsigned int              hops;
01219         int                       alive;
01220         unsigned int              pri;
01221 
01222         for (index = 0; ; index++) {
01223                 LIBCFS_IOC_INIT_V2(data, cfg_hdr);
01224                 data.cfg_count = index;
01225 
01226                 rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_GET_ROUTE, &data);
01227                 if (rc != 0)
01228                         break;
01229 
01230                 net     = data.cfg_net;
01231                 hops    = data.cfg_config_u.cfg_route.rtr_hop;
01232                 nid     = data.cfg_nid;
01233                 alive   = data.cfg_config_u.cfg_route.rtr_flags;
01234                 pri     = data.cfg_config_u.cfg_route.rtr_priority;
01235 
01236                 printf("net %18s hops %u gw %32s %s pri %u\n",
01237                        libcfs_net2str(net), hops,
01238                        libcfs_nid2str(nid), alive ? "up" : "down", pri);
01239         }
01240 
01241         if (errno != ENOENT)
01242                 fprintf(stderr, "Error getting routes: %s: check dmesg.\n",
01243                         strerror(errno));
01244 
01245         return 0;
01246 }
01247 
01248 static int
01249 fault_attr_nid_parse(char *str, lnet_nid_t *nid_p)
01250 {
01251         lnet_nid_t nid;
01252         __u32      net;
01253         int        rc = 0;
01254 
01255         /* NB: can't support range ipaddress except * and *@net */
01256         if (strlen(str) > 2 && str[0] == '*' && str[1] == '@') {
01257                 net = libcfs_str2net(str + 2);
01258                 if (net == LNET_NIDNET(LNET_NID_ANY))
01259                         goto failed;
01260 
01261                 nid = LNET_MKNID(net, LNET_NIDADDR(LNET_NID_ANY));
01262         } else {
01263                 rc = libcfs_str2anynid(&nid, str);
01264                 if (!rc)
01265                         goto failed;
01266         }
01267 
01268         *nid_p = nid;
01269         return 0;
01270 failed:
01271         fprintf(stderr, "Invalid NID : %s\n", str);
01272         return -1;
01273 }
01274 
01275 static int
01276 fault_attr_msg_parse(char *msg_str, __u32 *mask_p)
01277 {
01278         if (!strcasecmp(msg_str, "put")) {
01279                 *mask_p |= LNET_PUT_BIT;
01280                 return 0;
01281 
01282         } else if (!strcasecmp(msg_str, "ack")) {
01283                 *mask_p |= LNET_ACK_BIT;
01284                 return 0;
01285 
01286         } else if (!strcasecmp(msg_str, "get")) {
01287                 *mask_p |= LNET_GET_BIT;
01288                 return 0;
01289 
01290         } else if (!strcasecmp(msg_str, "reply")) {
01291                 *mask_p |= LNET_REPLY_BIT;
01292                 return 0;
01293         }
01294 
01295         fprintf(stderr, "unknown message type %s\n", msg_str);
01296         return -1;
01297 }
01298 
01299 static int
01300 fault_attr_ptl_parse(char *ptl_str, __u64 *mask_p)
01301 {
01302         unsigned long rc = strtoul(optarg, NULL, 0);
01303 
01304         if (rc >= 64) {
01305                 fprintf(stderr, "invalid portal: %lu\n", rc);
01306                 return -1;
01307         }
01308 
01309         *mask_p |= (1ULL << rc);
01310         return 0;
01311 }
01312 
01313 static int
01314 fault_simul_rule_add(__u32 opc, char *name, int argc, char **argv)
01315 {
01316         struct libcfs_ioctl_data  data = {{0}};
01317         struct lnet_fault_attr    attr;
01318         char                     *optstr;
01319         int                       rc;
01320 
01321         static struct option opts[] = {
01322                 {"source",      required_argument,      0,      's'},
01323                 {"dest",        required_argument,      0,      'd'},
01324                 {"rate",        required_argument,      0,      'r'},
01325                 {"interval",    required_argument,      0,      'i'},
01326                 {"latency",     required_argument,      0,      'l'},
01327                 {"portal",      required_argument,      0,      'p'},
01328                 {"message",     required_argument,      0,      'm'},
01329                 {0, 0, 0, 0}
01330         };
01331 
01332         if (argc == 1) {
01333                 fprintf(stderr, "Failed, please provide source, destination "
01334                                 "and rate of rule\n");
01335                 return -1;
01336         }
01337 
01338         optstr = opc == LNET_CTL_DROP_ADD ? "s:d:r:i:p:m:" : "s:d:r:l:p:m:";
01339         memset(&attr, 0, sizeof(attr));
01340         while (1) {
01341                 char c = getopt_long(argc, argv, optstr, opts, NULL);
01342 
01343                 if (c == -1)
01344                         break;
01345 
01346                 switch (c) {
01347                 case 's': /* source NID/NET */
01348                         rc = fault_attr_nid_parse(optarg, &attr.fa_src);
01349                         if (rc != 0)
01350                                 goto getopt_failed;
01351                         break;
01352 
01353                 case 'd': /* dest NID/NET */
01354                         rc = fault_attr_nid_parse(optarg, &attr.fa_dst);
01355                         if (rc != 0)
01356                                 goto getopt_failed;
01357                         break;
01358 
01359                 case 'r': /* drop rate */
01360                         if (opc == LNET_CTL_DROP_ADD)
01361                                 attr.u.drop.da_rate = strtoul(optarg, NULL, 0);
01362                         else
01363                                 attr.u.delay.la_rate = strtoul(optarg, NULL, 0);
01364                         break;
01365 
01366                 case 'i': /* time interval (# seconds) for message drop */
01367                         if (opc == LNET_CTL_DROP_ADD)
01368                                 attr.u.drop.da_interval = strtoul(optarg,
01369                                                                   NULL, 0);
01370                         else
01371                                 attr.u.delay.la_interval = strtoul(optarg,
01372                                                                    NULL, 0);
01373                         break;
01374 
01375                 case 'l': /* seconds to wait before activating rule */
01376                         attr.u.delay.la_latency = strtoul(optarg, NULL, 0);
01377                         break;
01378 
01379                 case 'p': /* portal to filter */
01380                         rc = fault_attr_ptl_parse(optarg, &attr.fa_ptl_mask);
01381                         if (rc != 0)
01382                                 goto getopt_failed;
01383                         break;
01384 
01385                 case 'm': /* message types to filter */
01386                         rc = fault_attr_msg_parse(optarg, &attr.fa_msg_mask);
01387                         if (rc != 0)
01388                                 goto getopt_failed;
01389                         break;
01390 
01391                 default:
01392                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: option '%s' "
01393                                 "unrecognized\n", argv[0], argv[optind - 1]);
01394                         goto getopt_failed;
01395                 }
01396         }
01397         optind = 1;
01398 
01399         if (opc == LNET_CTL_DROP_ADD) {
01400                 /* NB: drop rate and interval are exclusive to each other */
01401                 if (!((attr.u.drop.da_rate == 0) ^
01402                       (attr.u.drop.da_interval == 0))) {
01403                         fprintf(stderr,
01404                                 "please provide either drop rate or interval "
01405                                 "but not both at the same time.\n");
01406                         return -1;
01407                 }
01408         } else if (opc == LNET_CTL_DELAY_ADD) {
01409                 if (!((attr.u.delay.la_rate == 0) ^
01410                       (attr.u.delay.la_interval == 0))) {
01411                         fprintf(stderr,
01412                                 "please provide either delay rate or interval "
01413                                 "but not both at the same time.\n");
01414                         return -1;
01415                 }
01416 
01417                 if (attr.u.delay.la_latency == 0) {
01418                         fprintf(stderr, "latency cannot be zero\n");
01419                         return -1;
01420                 }
01421         }
01422 
01423         if (attr.fa_src == 0 || attr.fa_dst == 0) {
01424                 fprintf(stderr, "Please provide both source and destination "
01425                                 "of %s rule\n", name);
01426                 return -1;
01427         }
01428 
01429         data.ioc_flags = opc;
01430         data.ioc_inllen1 = sizeof(attr);
01431         data.ioc_inlbuf1 = (char *)&attr;
01432         if (libcfs_ioctl_pack(&data, &ioc_buf, IOC_BUF_SIZE) != 0) {
01433                 fprintf(stderr, "libcfs_ioctl_pack failed\n");
01434                 return -1;
01435         }
01436 
01437         rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_LNET_FAULT, ioc_buf);
01438         if (rc != 0) {
01439                 fprintf(stderr, "add %s rule %s->%s failed: %s\n",
01440                         name, libcfs_nid2str(attr.fa_src),
01441                         libcfs_nid2str(attr.fa_dst), strerror(errno));
01442                 return -1;
01443         }
01444 
01445         printf("Added %s rule %s->%s (1/%d)\n",
01446                name, libcfs_nid2str(attr.fa_src), libcfs_nid2str(attr.fa_dst),
01447                opc == LNET_CTL_DROP_ADD ?
01448                attr.u.drop.da_rate : attr.u.delay.la_rate);
01449         return 0;
01450 
01451 getopt_failed:
01452         optind = 1;
01453         return -1;
01454 }
01455 
01456 int
01457 jt_ptl_drop_add(int argc, char **argv)
01458 {
01459         return fault_simul_rule_add(LNET_CTL_DROP_ADD, "drop", argc, argv);
01460 }
01461 
01462 int
01463 jt_ptl_delay_add(int argc, char **argv)
01464 {
01465         return fault_simul_rule_add(LNET_CTL_DELAY_ADD, "delay", argc, argv);
01466 }
01467 
01468 static int
01469 fault_simul_rule_del(__u32 opc, char *name, int argc, char **argv)
01470 {
01471         struct libcfs_ioctl_data data = {{0}};
01472         struct lnet_fault_attr   attr;
01473         bool                     all = false;
01474         int                      rc;
01475 
01476         static struct option opts[] = {
01477                 {"source",      required_argument,      0,      's'},
01478                 {"dest",        required_argument,      0,      'd'},
01479                 {"all",         no_argument,            0,      'a'},
01480                 {0, 0, 0, 0}
01481         };
01482 
01483         if (argc == 1) {
01484                 fprintf(stderr, "Failed, please provide source and "
01485                                 "destination of rule\n");
01486                 return -1;
01487         }
01488 
01489         memset(&attr, 0, sizeof(attr));
01490         while (1) {
01491                 char c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "s:d:a", opts, NULL);
01492 
01493                 if (c == -1 || all)
01494                         break;
01495 
01496                 switch (c) {
01497                 case 's':
01498                         rc = fault_attr_nid_parse(optarg, &attr.fa_src);
01499                         if (rc != 0)
01500                                 goto getopt_failed;
01501                         break;
01502                 case 'd':
01503                         rc = fault_attr_nid_parse(optarg, &attr.fa_dst);
01504                         if (rc != 0)
01505                                 goto getopt_failed;
01506                         break;
01507                 case 'a':
01508                         attr.fa_src = attr.fa_dst = 0;
01509                         all = true;
01510                         break;
01511                 default:
01512                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: option '%s' "
01513                                 "unrecognized\n", argv[0], argv[optind - 1]);
01514                         goto getopt_failed;
01515                 }
01516         }
01517         optind = 1;
01518 
01519         data.ioc_flags = opc;
01520         data.ioc_inllen1 = sizeof(attr);
01521         data.ioc_inlbuf1 = (char *)&attr;
01522         if (libcfs_ioctl_pack(&data, &ioc_buf, IOC_BUF_SIZE) != 0) {
01523                 fprintf(stderr, "libcfs_ioctl_pack failed\n");
01524                 return -1;
01525         }
01526 
01527         rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_LNET_FAULT, ioc_buf);
01528         if (rc != 0) {
01529                 fprintf(stderr, "remove %s rule %s->%s failed: %s\n", name,
01530                         all ? "all" : libcfs_nid2str(attr.fa_src),
01531                         all ? "all" : libcfs_nid2str(attr.fa_dst),
01532                         strerror(errno));
01533                 return -1;
01534         }
01535 
01536         libcfs_ioctl_unpack(&data, ioc_buf);
01537         printf("Removed %d %s rules\n", data.ioc_count, name);
01538         return 0;
01539 
01540 getopt_failed:
01541         optind = 1;
01542         return -1;
01543 }
01544 
01545 int
01546 jt_ptl_drop_del(int argc, char **argv)
01547 {
01548         return fault_simul_rule_del(LNET_CTL_DROP_DEL, "drop", argc, argv);
01549 }

01557 static int
01558 fault_simul_rule_reset(__u32 opc, char *name, int argc, char **argv)
01559 {
01560         struct libcfs_ioctl_data   data = {{0}};
01561         int                        rc;
01562 
01563         LIBCFS_IOC_INIT(data);
01564         data.ioc_flags = opc;
01565 
01566         rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_LNET_FAULT, &data);
01567         if (rc != 0) {
01568                 fprintf(stderr, "failed to reset %s stats: %s\n",
01569                         name, strerror(errno));
01570                 return -1;
01571         }
01572         return 0;
01573 }

01587 
01588 static int
01589 fault_simul_rule_list(__u32 opc, char *name, int argc, char **argv)
01590 {
01591         struct libcfs_ioctl_data data = {{0}};
01592         struct lnet_fault_attr   attr;
01593         struct lnet_fault_stat   stat;
01594         int                      pos;
01595 
01596         printf("LNet %s rules:\n", name);
01597         for (pos = 0;; pos++) {
01598                 int             rc;
01599 
01600                 memset(&attr, 0, sizeof(attr));
01601                 memset(&stat, 0, sizeof(stat));
01602 
01603                 data.ioc_count = pos;
01604                 data.ioc_flags = opc;
01605                 data.ioc_inllen1 = sizeof(attr);
01606                 data.ioc_inlbuf1 = (char *)&attr;
01607                 data.ioc_inllen2 = sizeof(stat);
01608                 data.ioc_inlbuf2 = (char *)&stat;
01609                 if (libcfs_ioctl_pack(&data, &ioc_buf, IOC_BUF_SIZE) != 0) {
01610                         fprintf(stderr, "libcfs_ioctl_pack failed\n");
01611                         return -1;
01612                 }
01613 
01614                 rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_LNET_FAULT, ioc_buf);
01615                 if (rc != 0)
01616                         break;
01617 
01618                 libcfs_ioctl_unpack(&data, ioc_buf);
01619 
01620                 if (opc == LNET_CTL_DROP_LIST) {
01621                         printf("%s->%s (1/%d | %d) ptl %#jx, msg %x, "
01622                                "%ju/%ju, PUT %ju, ACK %ju, GET "
01623                                "%ju, REP %ju\n",
01624                                libcfs_nid2str(attr.fa_src),
01625                                libcfs_nid2str(attr.fa_dst),
01626                                attr.u.drop.da_rate, attr.u.drop.da_interval,
01627                                (uintmax_t)attr.fa_ptl_mask, attr.fa_msg_mask,
01628                                (uintmax_t)stat.u.drop.ds_dropped,
01629                                (uintmax_t)stat.fs_count,
01630                                (uintmax_t)stat.fs_put,
01631                                (uintmax_t)stat.fs_ack,
01632                                (uintmax_t)stat.fs_get,
01633                                (uintmax_t)stat.fs_reply);
01634 
01635                 } else if (opc == LNET_CTL_DELAY_LIST) {
01636                         printf("%s->%s (1/%d | %d, latency %d) ptl %#jx"
01637                                ", msg %x, %ju/%ju, PUT %ju"
01638                                ", ACK %ju, GET %ju, REP %ju\n",
01639                                libcfs_nid2str(attr.fa_src),
01640                                libcfs_nid2str(attr.fa_dst),
01641                                attr.u.delay.la_rate, attr.u.delay.la_interval,
01642                                attr.u.delay.la_latency,
01643                                (uintmax_t)attr.fa_ptl_mask, attr.fa_msg_mask,
01644                                (uintmax_t)stat.u.delay.ls_delayed,
01645                                (uintmax_t)stat.fs_count,
01646                                (uintmax_t)stat.fs_put,
01647                                (uintmax_t)stat.fs_ack,
01648                                (uintmax_t)stat.fs_get,
01649                                (uintmax_t)stat.fs_reply);
01650                 }
01651         }
01652         printf("found total %d\n", pos);
01653 
01654         return 0;
01655 }
01656 
01657 int
01658 jt_ptl_drop_list(int argc, char **argv)
01659 {
01660         return fault_simul_rule_list(LNET_CTL_DROP_LIST, "drop", argc, argv);
01661 }

01669 double
01670 get_cycles_per_usec ()
01671 {
01672         FILE      *f = fopen ("/proc/cpuinfo", "r");
01673         double     mhz;
01674         char      line[64];
01675 
01676         if (f != NULL) {
01677                 while (fgets (line, sizeof (line), f) != NULL)
01678                         if (sscanf (line, "cpu MHz : %lf", &mhz) == 1) {
01679                                 fclose (f);
01680                                 return (mhz);
01681                         }
01682                 fclose (f);
01683         }
01684 
01685         fprintf (stderr, "Can't read/parse /proc/cpuinfo\n");
01686         return (1000.0);
01687 }
01688 
01689 int jt_ptl_testprotocompat(int argc, char **argv)
01690 {
01691         struct libcfs_ioctl_data  data;
01692         int                       rc;
01693         int                       flags;
01694         char                     *end;
01695 
01696         if (argc < 2)  {
01697                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s <number>\n", argv[0]);
01698                 return 0;
01699         }
01700 
01701         flags = strtol(argv[1], &end, 0);
01702         if (flags < 0 || *end != 0) {
01703                 fprintf(stderr, "Can't parse flags '%s'\n", argv[1]);
01704                 return -1;
01705         }
01706 
01707         LIBCFS_IOC_INIT(data);
01708         data.ioc_flags = flags;
01709         rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_TESTPROTOCOMPAT, &data);
01710 
01711         if (rc != 0) {
01712                 fprintf(stderr, "test proto compat %x failed: %s\n",
01713                         flags, strerror(errno));
01714                 return -1;
01715         }
01716 
01717         printf("test proto compat %x OK\n", flags);
01718         return 0;
01719 }
